result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernardo Mireles Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office. 15CM95, Bail Jumping Misdemeanor, 946.49(1)(a) was dismissed and read-in to this case.
Concurrent with: Probation on Counts 1&3 in this case and 15CM46 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions. Costs of the action paid from bond posted in 15CM46.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Yesenia Moreno(Lopez), Jonathan Alfredo Moreno Lopez,  or Cesar Bravo Lozoya of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
  Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.

timeConds.notes:
Jail sentence applies to Count 1 only.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence in 15CF85 and 15CM46 to run concurrent to each other.

supervisions.notes:
Probation on counts 1&3 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified. FOR CONDITIONS SEE COUNT 1.
Concurrent with:  Probation on Counts 1&3 in this case and 15CM46 to run concurrent to each other.

miscConds.notes: Costs of the action paid from bond posted in 15CM46

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernardo Mireles Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Bernardo  Mireles Garcia, appeared with Attorney John Charles Bachman.  Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter. Agreement reached on all cases

Pre-trial conference at 09-08-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 10-08-2015 01:20 pm.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Bachman  Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information, complaint was read by DA by request of the defendant, defendant entered a NOT GUILTY plea to all counts on the information and misdemeanor cases.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Bernardo Mireles Garcia, appeared with Attorney John Charles Bachman.  Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter. Testimony taken
(9:57) Deputy Marty Schwantes-Clark County Sheriff Department-officer on scene
(10:04) cross (10:05) State rests and moves for bind over, Court finds probable cause and binds over  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:20 pm.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Bernardo Mireles Garcia, appeared via video from Clark County Jail with Attorney John Charles Bachman appearing in court  Susan Rascon Previously sworn as interpreter.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:50 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bernardo Mireles Garcia
Current: 509 N 2nd St, Abbotsford, WI 54405 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: 409 N 6th St, Abbotsford, WI 54405

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  
 The defendant shall have no contact with  J.A.M.L.of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Court Commission Sautebin appeared by telephone; No Court reporter present;  ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail.   Susan Rascon appeared by telephone as interpreter. Bond of $4000.00 set with no alcohol provision, no driving without proper license and no contact with J.L.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney
